title: Rugby World Cup: how well will your country do in the tournament?
text:
How far will your team go? Who are your standout players? What is the mood like in your country before the tournament?

Rugby World Cup: how well will your country do in the tournament?

The ninth Rugby World Cup begins in Japan next Friday, with the host nation taking on Russia in the first of 47 games in the tournament. This will be the first Rugby World Cup to be held in Asia. Twenty countries are taking part and we would like to hear from readers in all 20.

How to get in touch with us

What hopes do you have for your team in the next six weeks? How far will they go in the tournament? What is the mood like where you live? Are there any particular players you are looking forward to watching? Share your expectations with us by filling out the form below.

We’re also compiling views for a video we’ll hopefully be publishing on Instagram. If you’d like to take part, please email instagramstories@theguardian.com or get in touch via WhatsApp by adding the contact +44(0)7495 849246, and we’ll send you more details.

If you’re having trouble using the form, click here. Read terms of service here.
description: How far will your team go? Who are your standout players? What is the mood like in your country before the tournament?
